result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Vashon Pitts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gregory Vashon Pitts is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gregory Vashon Pitts was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

-No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
-No contact with victim Jessica K. unless approved by the agent.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes: -Serve 20 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.

records.addlTxt: Probation agent Kristina Phillips via telephone requesting to cancel the probation review hearing scheduled 02-03-2017 at 1:30pm  because the Department will be proceeding with revocation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gregory Vashon Pitts in court PRO SE.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Per agent request, case adjourned for Probation Review hearing due to possible new allegations and investigation needing to be completed.

Defendant Gregory Vashon Pitts in court PRO SE.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed. Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gregory Vashon Pitts in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State complied with victim notification. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. In chambers discussion placed on the record.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Jessica K. unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Two letters on behalf of the defendant

Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gregory Vashon Pitts in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. Court VACATES Jury Trial. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 DISMISSED.

Filed, Letter on behalf of defendant.

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gregory Vashon Pitts in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. No contact order remains in effect. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jessica K.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gregory Vashon Pitts in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/5/16 @ 1:30pm
